comments.body: in failure cases, how often is this logged?
the key is re-queued by a rate limiter with 1 min base delay and 1 hr max delay (backoff exponentially)
why after a second? Why not immediately?

Was following the [existing code](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/f48e18faa4dc035cc927c6a2b34c83c8475b55fa/staging/src/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi/controller.go#L156) for aggregating an APIService. 

I don't see strong benefit of doing one way verses the other when we add/update an APIService. The delaying interface makes more sense when we deal with [sync reaction](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/f48e18faa4dc035cc927c6a2b34c83c8475b55fa/staging/src/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi/controller.go#L114-L123) to avoid hot-loop. 

Maybe we chose to wait a second because we have just aggregated the spec and don't want to pull the HTTP handler again immediately (we will likely get the same ETag).
Just want to make sure this second is not a magic number, i.e. it breaks with zero or if the bootstrapping takes longer than the given time.
